com.github.epadronu.balin.core

Interface Browser

  • All Superinterfaces:
    JavaScriptSupport, WaitingSupport

    public Browser
extends JavaScriptSupport, WaitingSupport

    Balin's backbone. The Browser interface binds together the different abstractions that form part of the library.

    Additionally, this interface defines the entry point for the Domain-Specific Language which Balin is built around.

    • Method Detail

      • at

        @NotNull
<T extends Page> T at(@NotNull
                               kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super com.github.epadronu.balin.core.Browser,? extends T> factory)

        Tells the browser at what page it should be located.

        If the page defines an implicit at verification, then it will be invoked immediately. If such verification fails, Balin will throw a exception PageImplicitAtVerificationException in order to perform an early failure.

        // Given the Kotlin's website index page with content elements and no URL
class IndexPage(browser: Browser) : Page(browser) {

    override val at = at {
        title == this@IndexPage.title
    }

    val title = "Kotlin Programming Language"

    val navItems by lazy {
        `$`("a.nav-item").map { it.text }
    }

    val tryItBtn by lazy {
        `$`(".try-button", 0).text
    }

    val features by lazy {
        `$`("li.kotlin-feature").`$`("h3:nth-child(2)").map { it.text }
    }
}

Browser.drive(driverFactory) {
    // When I navigate to the Kotlin's page URL
    to("https://kotlinlang.org/")

    // And set the browser's page with `at`
    val page = at(::IndexPage)

    // Then I should change the browser's page to the given one
    assertEquals(title, page.title)

    // And I should get the navigation items
    assertEquals(page.navItems, listOf("Learn", "Community", "Try Online"))

    // And I should get the try-it button
    assertEquals(page.tryItBtn, "Try online")

    // And I should get the coolest features
    assertEquals(page.features, listOf("Concise", "Safe", "Interoperable", "Tool-friendly"))
}

        Type Parameters:
        T -

        the page's type.

        Parameters:
        factory - provides an instance of the page given the driver being used by the browser.
        Throws:
        PageImplicitAtVerificationException - if the page has an implicit at verification which have failed.
        See Also:
        exception PageImplicitAtVerificationException

      • to

        @NotNull
<T extends Page> T to(@NotNull
                               kotlin.jvm.functions.Function1<? super com.github.epadronu.balin.core.Browser,? extends T> factory)

        Navigates to the given page.

        If the page has not defined a URL, then a exception MissingPageUrlException will be thrown immediately since is not possible to perform the navigation.

        If the page defines an implicit at verification, then it will be invoked immediately. If such verification fails, Balin will throw a exception PageImplicitAtVerificationException in order to perform an early failure.

        // Given the Kotlin's website index page URL
val indexPageUrl = "https://kotlinlang.org/"

Browser.drive(driverFactory) {
    // When I visit such URL
    // Then I should change the browser's URL to the given one
    assertEquals(to(indexPageUrl), indexPageUrl)

    // And I should get the title of the Kotlin's website index page
    assertEquals(title, "Kotlin Programming Language")
}

        Type Parameters:
        T -

        the page's type.

        Parameters:
        factory - provides an instance of the page given the driver being used by the browser.
        Throws:
        MissingPageUrlException - if the page has not defined a URL.
        PageImplicitAtVerificationException - if the page has an implicit at verification which have failed.
        See Also:
        exception MissingPageUrlException, exception PageImplicitAtVerificationException, org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.get

      • to

        @NotNull
java.lang.String to(@NotNull
                             java.lang.String url)

        Navigates to the given URL.

        Parameters:
        url - the URL the browser will navigate to.
        Returns:
        The browser's current URL.
        See Also:
        org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver.get
